elements.label: layer-protocol
elements.comment: Please ignore this elements with field /leafrefPath/ for now.
elements.description: CoreModel-CoreNetworkModule-ObjectClasses:NetworkElement/_ltpRefList/_lpList/uuid

elements.label: air-interface-capability
elements.description: none

elements.label: air-interface-configuration
elements.description: none

elements.label: air-interface-status
elements.description: none

elements.label: air-interface-current-problems
elements.description: none

elements.label: air-interface-current-performance
elements.description: none

elements.label: air-interface-historical-performances
elements.description: none

elements.label: type-of-equipment
elements.description: This parameter indicates the equipment type. Instead of uploading the complete set of capabilities, capabilities of the same equipment type could be reused. Should be unique for a combination of modem, radio and their respective firmware.

elements.label: tx-frequency-min
elements.description: Value of the minimum transmit frequency tunable at the air interface.

elements.label: tx-frequency-max
elements.description: Value of the maximum transmit frequency tunable at the air interface.

elements.label: rx-frequency-min
elements.description: Value of the minimum receive frequency tunable at the air interface.

elements.label: rx-frequency-max
elements.description: Value of the maximum receive frequency tunable at the air interface.

elements.label: adaptive-modulation-is-avail
elements.description: In case the device is capable of adaptive modulation, this field shall contain a 'true'.

elements.label: mimo-is-avail
elements.description: In case the device is capable of MIMO, this field shall contain a 'true'.

elements.label: mimo-channels
elements.description: Maximum number (n) of spatial multiplexing streams that can be conveyed by an n x n MIMO configuration.

elements.label: alic-is-avail
elements.description: In case the microwave radio is capable of Adjacent Link Interference Cancelation (canceling of interference cause by transmitters located at the same site), this field shall contain a 'true'.

elements.label: atpc-is-avail
elements.description: In case the microwave radio is capable of ATPC, this field shall contain a 'true'.

elements.label: atpc-range
elements.description: Extent of the ATPC range.

elements.label: encryption-is-avail
elements.description: Shall be marked 'true', if payload encryption is available.

elements.label: maintenance-timer-range
elements.description: Available time periods for maintenance configurations (e.g. the loop back of microwave header information) to be described. Concrete values shall be separated by commas (e.g. '10, 60, 360'). Ranges shall be expressed as two values separated by a minus (e.g. '10-360').

elements.label: supported-alarms
elements.description: Available alarms to be listed. Mandatory:'signalIsLost','rslIsExceeded','temperatureIsExceeded','modemIsFaulty','radioIsFaulty' and 'modulationIsDownShifted'. Further alarms might be added by the device. Names are to be separated by commas.

elements.label: supported-loop-back-kind-list

options.description: Intermediate Frequency on the interface between indoor and outdoor unit.
Radio Frequency on the interface between outdoor unit and outdoor unit at the remote site.

elements.description: List of supported kinds of looping back of header information to the remote site.

elements.label: supported-channel-plan-list
elements.description: List of channel spacing that are supported by the device.

views.name: supported-channel-plan-list
views.title: supported-channel-plan-list

elements.label: supported-channel-plan
elements.description: Unique name (e.g. ECC/REC/(01)04_Annex 5) of a document, which describes a frequency grid that can be adjusted at the air interface. Corresponding channel plans to be delivered by the hardware vendor and to be stored by the operator in an controller/application attached database.

elements.label: duplex-distance-is-variable
elements.description: To be set on 'true', if the distance between transmitted and received frequency is variable.

elements.label: duplex-distance
elements.description: Distance between transmitted and received frequency.

elements.label: auto-freq-select-is-avail
elements.description: In case the microwave radio is capable of automatically selecting the transmit frequency in unlicensed bands, this field shall contain a 'true'.

elements.label: transmission-mode-list
elements.description: none

views.description: List of channel spacing that are supported by the device.

elements.label: transmission-mode-id
elements.description: Indentifies the transmissionMode for internal reference.

elements.label: channel-bandwidth
elements.description: Bandwidth of the transmit channel. The value shall be expressed explicitly (means in kHz) not as a reference to an international agreement. The values shall be chosen from the following _list: 3.500, 7.000, 14.000, 27.500, 28.000, 29.000, 29.650, 30.000, 40.000, 50.000, 55.000, 56.000, 59.300, 60.000, 80.000, 100.000, 112.000, 120.000, 150.000, 200.000, 250.000, 500.000, 750.000, 1.000.000, 1.250.000, 1.500.000, 1.750.000, 2.000.000;

elements.label: modulation-scheme
elements.description: Modulation scheme, which is base to the other characteristics described in the same transmissionModeType data type. The modulation scheme shall be described by the number of states in the phase diagram (e.g. BPSK->'2' or 256QAM->'256').

elements.label: code-rate
elements.description: Code rate of the coding scheme in % (Net bit rate ? Gross bit rate ? code rate).

elements.label: tx-power-min
elements.description: Value of the minimum transmit power the modem can operate in dBm.

elements.label: tx-power-max
elements.description: Value of the maximum transmit power the modem can operate in dBm.

elements.label: rx-threshold
elements.description: Value of the receive level required to decode the received signal with a Bit Error Rate of 1e-6 or less.

elements.label: am-upshift-level
elements.description: Value of the receive level that has to be exceeded to shift into a higher modulation scheme.

elements.label: am-downshift-level
elements.description: Value of the receive level that has to be exceeded for not shifting into a lower modulation scheme.

elements.label: xpic-is-avail
elements.description: In case this air interface type is capable of XPIC, this field shall contain a 'true'. This information shall purely relate to capabilities of the equipment type, but not to the operational capability of a specific hardware composition on site. Means for example that this attribute might contain a 'true' statement, even if an additional cable would have been required to actually operate XPIC in a specific case.

elements.label: air-interface-name
elements.description: Operator specific microwave link ID (often used for coding area, type of element and sequential number).

elements.label: radio-signal-id
elements.description: The radioSignalId is transmitted on the air interface so the remote site of the link synchronizes on the correct transmitter. The local radio MUST NOT synchronize on a radio signal with a different radioSignalId. The link ID is neither an ID necessary to span the model nor an ID referencing external data. It is just some sort of name of the link transmitted so the correct remote site can be identified in an interference situation. The value zero might be used to make the microwave to disable the link ID check.

elements.label: tx-frequency
elements.description: Center frequency of the transmit channel. The values to be configured have to exactly match the values listed in the international agreement referenced in channelPlanID. In case of automated selection of the transmit frequency this field shall describe the lowest center frequency selectable.

elements.label: rx-frequency
elements.description: Center frequency of the receive channel.

elements.label: tx-channel-bandwidth
elements.description: Bandwidth of the transmit channel. The value shall be expressed explicitly (means in kHz) not as a reference to an international agreement. The values shall be chosen from the following _list: 3.500, 7.000, 14.000, 27.500, 28.000, 29.000, 29.650, 30.000, 40.000, 50.000, 55.000, 56.000, 59.300, 60.000, 80.000, 100.000, 112.000, 120.000, 150.000, 200.000, 250.000, 500.000, 750.000, 1.000.000, 1.250.000, 1.500.000, 1.750.000, 2.000.000;

elements.label: rx-channel-bandwidth
elements.description: Bandwidth of the receive channel. The value shall be expressed explicitly (means in kHz) not as a reference to an international agreement. The values shall be chosen from the following _list: 3.500, 7.000, 14.000, 27.500, 28.000, 29.000, 29.650, 30.000, 40.000, 50.000, 55.000, 56.000, 59.300, 60.000, 80.000, 100.000, 112.000, 120.000, 150.000, 200.000, 250.000, 500.000, 750.000, 1.000.000, 1.250.000, 1.500.000, 1.750.000, 2.000.000;

elements.label: polarization
elements.description: Allows documenting the polarization of the air interface.

elements.label: power-is-on
elements.description: Power ON. Activation of the entire radio in a split mount configuration shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: transmitter-is-on
elements.description: Activation of the transmitter inside the radio shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: receiver-is-on
elements.description: Maintenance Feature. Activation of the receiver inside the radio shall be expressed as a 'true'. Attribute shall also be used for RX main and RX diversity squelches in case of diversity configurations.

elements.label: tx-power
elements.description: Transmit power to be configured on the microwave link. Signed Byte is required. The actually operated transmit power might be lower depending on adaptive modulation and ATPC.

elements.label: adaptive-modulation-is-on
elements.description: Adaptive Modulation. Activation of adaptive modulation shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: modulation-min
elements.description: Minimum modulation to be configured (in case adaptive modulation is not used, this value represents also the fixed modulation). The modulation scheme shall be described by the number of states in the phase diagram (e.g. BPSK->'2' or 256QAM->'256'). Allowed values are defined in TypeDefinitions::transmissionModeType::modulationScheme.

elements.label: modulation-max
elements.description: Maximum modulation to be configured. The value of this field is only relevant, if Adaptive Modulation has been activated. The modulation scheme shall be described by the number of states in the phase diagram (e.g. BPSK->'2' or 256QAM->'256'). Allowed values are defined in TypeDefinitions::transmissionModeType::modulationScheme.

elements.label: xpic-is-on
elements.description: Activation of Cross Polarization Interference Cancelation shall be expressed as a 'true'. In case XPIC is not available for the current combination of channel bandwidth and modulation or the hardware in general, this parameter shall always be set to 'false'.

elements.label: mimo-is-on
elements.description: Activation of Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO) shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: alic-is-on
elements.description: Activation of Adjacent Link Interference Cancelation (ALIC) shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: atpc-is-on
elements.description: ATPC. Activation of Automated Transmit Power Control shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: atpc-thresh-upper
elements.description: If the receive level is higher than the upper threshold value, the transmitter is notified to decrease transmit power.

elements.label: atpc-thresh-lower
elements.description: If the receive level is lower than the lower threshold value, the transmitter is notified to increase transmit power.

elements.label: auto-freq-select-is-on
elements.description: Activation of automatically selecting the transmit frequency in unlicensed bands shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: auto-freq-select-range
elements.description: Number of transmit channels (starting at the center frequency defined in txFrequency and with channel bandwidth according to txChannelBandwidth) that define the range within the transmit frequency can automatically been chosen.

elements.label: modulation-is-on
elements.description: Maintenance Feature. De-activation of the modulation of the carrier signal for fault management shall be expressed as a 'false'.

elements.label: encryption-is-on
elements.description: Activates encryption of the payload.

elements.label: cryptographic-key
elements.description: Key for transforming plaintext into ciphertext data.

elements.label: loop-back-kind-on

options.description: Intermediate Frequency on the interface between indoor and outdoor unit.
Radio Frequency on the interface between outdoor unit and outdoor unit at the remote site.

elements.description: Maintenance Feature. The currently configured type of looping back of the air interface header shall be expressed here. The received header is returned to the remote site.

elements.label: maintenance-timer
elements.description: Time of existence of any maintenance configuration (e.g. the loop back of microwave header information). Valid values are defined in AirInterface::AirInterfaceCapability::maintenanceTimerRange.

elements.label: problem-kind-severity-list
elements.description: Severity of the problem to be configured.

views.name: problem-kind-severity-list
views.title: problem-kind-severity-list

elements.label: problem-kind-name
elements.description: Name of the alarm according to AirInterface::AirInterfaceCapability::supportedAlarms

elements.label: problem-kind-severity
elements.description: Severity of this type of alarm.

views.description: Severity of the problem to be configured.

elements.label: tx-frequency-cur
elements.description: Center frequency of the currently operated transmit channel.

elements.label: rx-frequency-cur
elements.description: Center frequency of the currently operated receive channel.

elements.label: tx-level-cur
elements.description: Current transmit level.

elements.label: rx-level-cur
elements.description: Current receive level.

elements.label: modulation-cur
elements.description: Currently operated modulation on transmit path. The modulation scheme shall be described by the number of states in the phase diagram (e.g. BPSK->'2' or 256QAM->'256'). Allowed values are defined in TypeDefinitions::transmissionModeType::modulationScheme.

elements.label: code-rate-cur
elements.description: Code rate of the currently operated coding scheme (Net bit rate ? Gross bit rate ? code rate).

elements.label: snir-cur
elements.description: Currently measured signal to (noise+interference) ratio.

elements.label: xpd-cur
elements.description: Currently measured cross polarization discrimination.

elements.label: rf-temp-cur
elements.description: Current temperature (in degree Celsius) of the radio module inside the outdoor unit.

elements.label: last-status-change
elements.description: Time the Air Interface entered its current operational status.

elements.label: radio-power-is-up
elements.description: If the radio unit has power and is switched on, this shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: link-is-up
elements.description: If connection is established to the remote site with the same linkID, this shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: xpic-is-up
elements.description: If XPIC is currently actually working (not just configured), this shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: mimo-is-up
elements.description: If MIMO is currently actually working (not just configured), this shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: alic-is-up
elements.description: If Adjacent Link Interference Cancelation (ALIC) is currently actually working (not just configured), this shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: atpc-is-up
elements.description: If ATPC is currently actually working (not just configured), this shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: auto-freq-select-is-up
elements.description: If automated frequency selection is currently actually working (not just configured), this shall be expressed as a 'true'.

elements.label: loop-back-kind-up

options.description: Intermediate Frequency on the interface between indoor and outdoor unit.
Radio Frequency on the interface between outdoor unit and outdoor unit at the remote site.

elements.description: The currently active (not just configured) type of looping back of the air interface header shall be expressed here. The received header is returned to the remote site.

elements.label: local-end-point-id
elements.description: The value of the localEndPointId is a vendor specific identifier of the air interface, used by the node to discover a microwave radio link.

elements.label: remote-end-point-id
elements.description: The value of the remoteEndPointId is a vendor specific identifier or the airinterface at the remote side, used to by the node to discover a microwave radio link.

elements.label: problem-name

elements.label: sequence-number
elements.description: Unique sequence number of the current problem object.

elements.label: time-stamp
elements.description: Time and date of the problem.

elements.label: problem-severity
elements.description: Severity of the alarm.

elements.label: current-performance-data-list
elements.description: At least values of the counters, which are reset every 15 minutes, are to be provided. If available, the current values of the counters, which are reset every 24 hour, can be provided, too.

views.name: mw-air-interface-hsb-end-point-pac
views.title: mw-air-interface-hsb-end-point-pac

elements.label: role
elements.description: none

elements.label: endpoint
elements.comment: Please ignore this elements with field /leafrefPath/ for now.
elements.description: none

views.description: The EndPoint (EP) object class models the access to the FC function. Each EndPoint instance has a role (e.g., working, protection, protected, hub, spoke, leaf, root, etc.) with respect to the FC function. The association of the FC to LTPs is made via EndPoints (essentially the ports of the FC) where each EndPoint (EP) of the FC has a role in the context of the FC. The traffic forwarding between the associated End PointsEPs of the FC depends upon the type of FC and may be associated with FCSwitch object instances. In cases where there is protection conveys the protecting role of the access to the FC. The EP replaces the Protection Unit of a traditional protection model. It represents a protected (resilient/reliable) point or a protecting (unreliable working or protection) point.

views.name: mw-air-interface-hsb-fc-switch-pac
views.title: mw-air-interface-hsb-fc-switch-pac

elements.label: prot-type
elements.description: Indicates the protection scheme that is used for the ProtectionGroup.

elements.label: air-interface-hsb-configuration-is-faulty-severity
elements.description: The level of severity of an airInterfaceHsbConfigurationIsFaulty alarm shall be chosen from an enumeration.

elements.label: air-interface-hsb-is-partly-down-severity
elements.description: The level of severity for one link out of the HSB configuration being down shall be chosen from an enumeration.

elements.label: air-interface-hsb-is-down-severity
elements.description: The level of severity of the total HSB configuration being down shall be chosen from an enumeration.

elements.label: fcswitch
elements.comment: Please ignore this elements with field /leafrefPath/ for now.
elements.description: none

views.description: Represents and defines a protection switch structure encapsulated in the forwarding construct. Essentially performs the function of Protection Group. Associates to 2 or more Endpoints each playing the role of a Protection Unit. One or more protection EndPoints (standby/backup) provide protection for one or more working (i.e. regular/main/preferred) Endpoints where either protection or working can feed one or more protected Endpoint. May be used in revertive or non-revertive (symmetric) mode. When in revertive mode may define waitToRestore time. May be used in one of several modes including source switch, destination switched, source and destination switched etc (covering cases such as 1+1 ane 1:1). May be lockout (prevented from switching), force switched or manual switched. Will indicate switch state and change of state.

elements.label: air-interface-diversity-status

options.description: All air interfaces that are members of the diversity configuration are down.
At least one, but not all of the air interfaces that are part of the diversity configuration is not working.
All air interfaces that are part of the diversity configuration are working.

elements.description: none

elements.description: none

elements.label: pure-ethernet-structure-historical-performances

views.description: The pureEthernetStructure_Pac and its attached classes MUST be provided on management interfaces of microwave devices, which are transporting Ethernet traffic only.

elements.label: structure-id
elements.description: Identifies the Structure for bundling and container.

elements.label: supported-alarms
elements.description: Available alarms to be listed. Mandatory:non. Names are to be separated by commas. Further alarms might be added by the device.

elements.label: problem-kind-severity-list
elements.description: Severity of the type of problem to be configured.

views.name: problem-kind-severity-list
views.title: problem-kind-severity-list

elements.label: problem-kind-name
elements.description: Name of the alarm according to Structure::StructureCapability::supportedAlarms

elements.label: problem-kind-severity
elements.description: Severity of this type of alarm.

views.description: Severity of the type of problem to be configured.

elements.label: last-status-change
elements.description: Time and date of the last update of the status information.

elements.label: segment-status-list
elements.description: Status of the Ethernet transport segment. Always just one segment.

views.name: segment-status-list
views.title: segment-status-list

elements.label: segment-status-type-id
elements.description: none

elements.label: segment-is-reserved-for-tdm
elements.description: The number of segments, which is configured by Structure::StructureConfiguration::tdmReservedNumberOfSegements, has to be reserved for TDM. Starting from the lowest index value, these segments have to be marked with a 'true' in segmentIsReservedForTdm.

elements.label: operational-status
elements.description: Current operational status of each segment.

elements.label: obsolete-priority-class
elements.description: PriorityClass as inherited from the associated Container::ContainerConfiguration::priorityClass. In case the device is capable of adapting the sequence, in which segments are being dropped in case of decreasing capacity of the air interface, priorityClass shall be considered, while calculating the dropOrderRank.

elements.label: obsolete-drop-order-rank
elements.description: In case the device is NOT capable of adapting the sequence, in which segments are being dropped in case of decreasing capacity of the air interface, dropOrderRank is number of segments minus sequence number of the segment. In case the device is capable of adapting the sequence, dropOrderRank has to be calculated by the device in dependency to the assigned priorityClass. _unique: within Structure::StructureStatus::segmentStatusList

views.description: Status of the Ethernet transport segment. Always just one segment.

elements.label: current-problem-list
elements.description: none

elements.label: problem-name
elements.description: Name of the alarm according to Structure::StructureCapability::supportedAlarms

elements.label: sequence-number
elements.description: Unique sequence number of the current problem object.

elements.label: time-stamp
elements.description: Time and date of the problem.

elements.label: problem-severity
elements.description: Severity of the alarm.

elements.label: current-performance-data-list
elements.description: At least values of the counters, which are reset every 15 minutes, are to be provided. If available, the current values of the counters, which are reset every 24 hour, can be provided, too.

views.title: current-performance-data-list

elements.label: performance-data
elements.description: none

elements.label: structure-id
elements.description: Identifies the Structure for bundling and container.

elements.label: supported-alarms
elements.description: Available alarms to be listed. Mandatory:non. Names are to be separated by commas. Further alarms might be added by the device.

elements.label: max-number-of-segments-reservable
elements.description: Device specific maximum number of segments (not depending on current air interface configuration) that can be reserved for this type of segment on a single air interface.

views.description: Lists the TDM frame types that are supported.

elements.label: number-of-tdm-segments-to-be-reserved
elements.description: Allows to configure the number of segments reserved for TDM frames of the type specified in HybridMwStructure::HybridMwStructureConfiguration::structureType

elements.description: TDM frame to be applied.

elements.description: Severity of the type of problem to be configured.

elements.description: Names to be chosen from the following list: 'e1','t1','j1','e3','ds3','stm1','cpri1','cpri2','cpri3','cpri4','cpri5','cpri6' or 'cpri7'

elements.description: PriorityClass as inherited from the associated Container::ContainerConfiguration::priorityClass. In case the device is capable of adapting the sequence, in which segments are being dropped in case of decreasing capacity of the air interface, priorityClass shall be considered, while calculating the dropOrderRank.

elements.label: obsolete-drop-order-rank
elements.description: In case the device is NOT capable of adapting the sequence, in which segments are being dropped in case of decreasing capacity of the air interface, dropOrderRank is number of segments minus sequence number of the segment. In case the device is capable of adapting the sequence, dropOrderRank has to be calculated by the device in dependency to the assigned priorityClass. _unique: within Structure::StructureStatus::segmentStatusList

elements.label: ethernet-container-capability
elements.description: none

elements.label: ethernet-container-configuration
elements.description: none

elements.label: ethernet-container-status
elements.description: none

elements.label: ethernet-container-current-problems
elements.description: none

elements.label: ethernet-container-current-performance
elements.description: none

elements.label: ethernet-container-historical-performances
elements.description: none

elements.label: bundling-is-avail
elements.description: This attribute has to be set on 'true', if the device allows combining resources from several air interfaces for transporting this Ethernet container.

elements.label: packet-compression-is-avail
elements.description: In case packet compression can be activated, but not configured to a certain type, packetCompressionAvail shall be set on 'true', but none of the compression level specific booleans.

elements.label: layer2-compression-is-avail
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 2 available at the device.

elements.label: vlan-compression-is-avail
elements.description: Packet compression on VLAN layer available at the device.

elements.label: q-in-q-compression-is-avail
elements.description: Packet compression on layer of a second VLAN available at the device.

elements.label: mpls-compression-is-avail
elements.description: Packet compression on mpls layer available at the device.

elements.label: ipv4-compression-is-avail
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 3 for IPv4 available at the device.

elements.label: ipv6-compression-is-avail
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 3 for IPv6 available at the device.

elements.label: layer4-compression-is-avail
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 4 (TCP and UDP header) available at the device.

elements.label: encryption-is-avail
elements.description: Shall be marked 'true', if Ethernet payload encryption is available.

elements.label: supported-alarms
elements.description: Available alarms to be listed. Mandatory:'framingIsFaulty' and 'containerIsDown'. Further alarms might be added by the device.

elements.label: container-id
elements.description: ContainterID in Netconf must be the same as EthernetPortID in OpenFlow so a connection can be made between the two items, which separately exist in the controller.

elements.label: packet-compression-is-on
elements.description: In case packet compression is activated, but no type is activated, it is assumed that the device chooses the optimum.

elements.label: layer2-compression-is-on
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 2 configured at the device.

elements.label: vlan-compression-is-on
elements.description: Packet compression on VLAN layer configured at the device.

elements.label: q-in-q-compression-is-on
elements.description: Packet compression on layer of a second VLAN configured at the device.

elements.label: mpls-compression-is-on
elements.description: Packet compression on MPLS layer configured at the device.

elements.label: ipv4-compression-is-on
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 3 for IPv4 configured at the device.

elements.label: ipv6-compression-is-on
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 3 for IPv6 configured at the device.

elements.label: layer4-compression-is-on
elements.description: Packet compression on layer 4 (TCP and UDP header) configured at the device.

elements.label: encryption-is-on
elements.description: Activates encryption of the Ethernet payload.

elements.label: cryptographic-key
elements.description: Key for transforming plaintext into cipher text data.

elements.label: segments-id-list
elements.description: Lists the segments used for transporting this Ethernet container. In case EthernetContainer::ContainerCapability::bundlingIsAvail==0, all TypeDefinitions::segmentIdType::structureId must be identical in the list.

elements.label: problem-kind-severity-list
elements.description: Severity of the problem to be configured.

views.name: segments-id-list
views.title: segments-id-list

elements.label: structure-id-ref
elements.description: none

elements.label: segment-id-ref
elements.description: Combinations of structureId and segmentId must be unique inside the device to assure that every resource is used just once.

views.description: Lists the segments used for transporting this Ethernet container. In case EthernetContainer::ContainerCapability::bundlingIsAvail==0, all TypeDefinitions::segmentIdType::structureId must be identical in the list.

elements.label: performance-data
elements.description: none

elements.label: tx-ethernet-bytes-max-s
elements.description: Counts the number of Bytes of Ethernet traffic (before header compression) transmitted within a second and keeps the highest value within the measurement period. Field to be left blank for all types of TDM containers.

elements.label: tx-ethernet-bytes-max-m
elements.description: Counts the number of Bytes of Ethernet traffic (before header compression) transmitted within a minute and keeps the highest value with in the measurement period. Field to be left blank for all types of TDM containers.

elements.label: tx-ethernet-bytes-sum
elements.description: Total number of Bytes of Ethernet traffic (before header compression) transmitted (in direction out of the device) during the measurement period. Field to be left blank for all types of TDM containers.

elements.label: time-period
elements.description: Total length of the measurement period in seconds.
